Save 30%+5% Additional Discount On Promocode PANACEAMSME*

What is UDYAM Registration?

A certificate issued to a micro/ small scale industry under the MSME Act, 2008is known as Udyam Registration.

Earlier, it was known as MSME registration in India. The main purpose of Udyam registration is to protect

medium and small scale industries from financially suffering at the hands of big enterprises,

.and to have smooth access to the benefits provided by the government.

Udyam registration enjoys some benefits like:

  • Concession on electricity bills

  • Exemption under direct tax laws

  • 50% subsidy on patent fees and trademark

  • Exemption of 1% interest rate on overdraft, etc.

    • Who Is A Sole Proprietor?

    A sole proprietor is an individual person who run a business in a distinguished name personally.

    Sole proprietorship gives an individually all rights to have complete control over his business.

    He would solely benefit from the business’s revenue and will be responsible for all the debts.

    In case of sole proprietor there comes an unlimited liability which means he have to sett off all

    his debt from his personal property.

    Eligibility for Udyam Registration

    The micro, small and medium enterprises that are eligible for Udyam registration according to their investment in plant and machinery are given below:

    1 Micro enterprises – Up to Rs. 25 lakhs invested in plant and machinery

    2 Small enterprises – Up to Rs. 5 crores invested in plant and machinery

    3 Medium enterprises – Up to Rs. 10 crores invested in plant and machinery

    Documentation Required:

  • Pan Card

  • GST certificate

  • Aadhaar card

  • Date of commencement of business

  • MSME certificate (if already registered0

  • Social category of the entrepreneur (general /SC/ST/OBC)

  • Mobile number and e-mail address of the company

  • Bank account number and IFSC code (or a copy of the passbook)

  • Number of employees (with division of males/females/others (if any))

  • Nature of business

  • Latest audited financial statements
